Ghana: Local Graduate Joins ISIS 
Professor Mark Oladipo of CERT, ABU on behalf of the staff said since the two centres were moved from the Energy Commission to NAEC in 2007 for coordination, the development and progress of the centres took a downward trend. 
Oladipo said the functions of the two centres were adversely affected following the Director General's total control of their academic, administrative and financial matters. 
He said "No capital allocation was released to the two centres of NAEC since 2007. However the commission executes capital projects which have no bearing for the needs of the sector." 
He said the chairman of NAEC had also stopped the payment of the approved ionizing radiation allowance in consideration of radiation hazards which the workers are being exposed to. 
Prof. Adeniyi Fasasi from CERD, Ile Ife said: "After being trained by the government nothing is being given to you to carry out your work. We are emphasizing on lack of competence in the leadership of NAEC and we are exposing what is happening so that government will investigate the leadership." 
He noted that the Act establishing the commission stipulates that the chairman is supposed to be there for three years and renewable once but that Osaisai has been there for nine years now. 
When contacted, chairman of NAEC denied the allegations, saying the commission spent its resources based on the percentage allocated to it. Nigeria
